Jack Frost.Action: Expresses fear and confusion about his existence, then finds comfort in the moonlight.
Politely greets townsfolk and attempts friendly conversation.
Feels shocked and saddened when ignored and passes through by townsfolk, then retreats quietly.
No direct action, statements, or involvement observed in this excerpt; others take lead on serious matters.
Not present or directly involved in this excerpt; no direct demonstration of skill, intelligence, or confidence.
Appears as the newly chosen Guardian, standing silently while others react.
Appears as the newly chosen Guardian, commanding attention and admiration from others.
Has a reputation with Bunnymund for being irresponsible and selfish, messing with egg hunts and freezing water pipes.

Creates a patch of ice causing a mailman to fall on his butt.

Causes a gust of wind that scatters a writer's papers.
